result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Davis-Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(b).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(b).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
With huber. If late to report to jail, no Huber privileges.
Each ct concur. Concur to cts 1 & 4.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AW or RW or any member of their family and any residence at which AW resides. Banned from Design Shelter Madison, WI. Not reside in any residence where firearms are located.

Comply with injunction in case no. 14CV1645. Take all medications as prescribed. Def agrees not to contest a petition for injunction if the victim seeks an extension or files a new petition upon expiration of the injunction in Case no. 14CV1645.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.
$243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

supervisions.notes: $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

miscConds.notes: $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

for Specific Performance to Enforce Unilateral Contract for Plea Agreement, Based upon defendant's full perfomance of his responsibilities on the contract

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Richard W. or any member of his immediate family.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alise W. or any member of her immediate family.
- Defendant shall not be at Design Shelters in Middleton, WI.
- Defendant shall not be within one block of Alise W.'s residence.
- Defendant shall not be within one block of Richard W.'s residence.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Dane County case No. 14CV1645.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
